author: Special Correspondent
text:
Over 300 members of the Tamil Nadu Government Employees Association (TNGEA) courted arrest in front of Directorate of Medical Services office complex in Teynampet on Wednesday afternoon as their strike entered the eighth day.

They are demanding the implementation of their demands that include restoration of the old pension scheme, allowance on par with central government employees.

They have also sought distribution of increment in cash and re-appointment of Makkal Mala Paniyalargal, who were dismissed from service, pay revision once in five years and filling of vacancies among others.
title: 300 government employees stage protest
